CCAK Study Guide, p. 115, Section 2.4.4 Differences in Legacy and Cloud Compliance Programs,
"With the introduction of cloud technologies, a major difference is the reliance on third parties for the delivery of resources, limiting the direct control and influence of the customer over the quality, availability and reliability of the services that a third party provides. Moreover, the same physical limitations exist (to the extent that the CSP attains the various compliance requirements), and at best are supplemented by virtual abstractions represented by software and automation. Hence, the concept of the cloud compliance program becomes the only vehicle available to validate the performance of the many cloud providers that my be fulfilling the compliance and business needs of the organization."

questions.question_text: Which of the following is the MOST important audit scope document when conducting a review of a cloud service provider?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
As per CCAK page 253 audit scope identifies systems and processes to be assessed

Selected Answer: C
When conducting an audit of a cloud service provider, the most important audit scope document is:

C. Processes and systems to be audited

Understanding the processes and systems to be audited is crucial because it defines the boundaries and focus of the audit. This document outlines what specific areas, technologies, and operations within the cloud service provider's environment will be assessed. It ensures that the audit covers all relevant aspects that are necessary for evaluating compliance, security, and performance. Without clearly defined processes and systems to audit, it would be challenging to determine the necessary procedures, criteria, and evidence needed for a comprehensive review.

Selected Answer: C
The audit scope identifies the systems and processes to be assessed. Prior to starting an audit is important to understand its scope and whether it aligns with the stated objectives and purpose. P# 253

choices.C: Processes and systems to be audited

questions.question_text: When establishing cloud governance, an organization should FIRST test by migrating:

choices.A: all applications at once to the cloud.
choices.D: a few applications to the cloud.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
When establishing cloud governance, an organization should FIRST test by migrating:

D. a few applications to the cloud.

Starting with a few applications allows the organization to test and refine their cloud governance processes, manage risks, and identify any potential issues on a smaller scale before proceeding with larger or more complex migrations.
